alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Johnson County through 745 PM MDT... At 714 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake De Smet, which is also 7 miles north of Buffalo, moving south at 10 mph. Showers and storms continue to build south toward the town of Buffalo. HAZARD...Heavy rain and pea sized hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Reduced visibility and ponding of water on roadways. Locations impacted include... Buffalo, and ranches and homes along both Rock Creek Road and French Creek Road. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between mile markers 295 and 299. Interstate 90 between mile markers 43 and 66. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rain is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Seek shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County
